intro: Dichorisandra neglecta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and indirect sunlight. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, making it a popular ornamental plant. Dichorisandra neglecta is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in indoor conditions.
